title: Don't want to be the one to complain, but......this patcher issue....
body: I had originally thought this was a minor patch, yet again I was wrong. There's no such thing as a minor patch with Riot. I was stuck at 99% for only a matter of minutes until I received an "error" and was told to restart my client to "FIX" the issue. Well, here I am on my 4th attempt at this whole "fix" ordeal. Keep in mind I have let it run to 2500-5000 files each time and I've also ran a repair, restarted my client, restarted my computer AND I have no connection issues. Any help is appreciated, Thanks!

replies.body:
Hey everyone, 

We know that this is a really painful experience, and we're working on getting a fix out to you ASAP. 
In the meantime, although the file scanning phase is long, the best thing to do is just let it run. Restarting your client
more than once after seeing the unspecified error won't make it complete more quickly, and actually restarts the scanning process from the beginning. 

Although it is taking a long time to scan, you should complete patching this way and will be able to play.

Yet a lot of game developers manage to avoid this by actually testing the patch before it's released, where as the ones who just churn out patch after patch week on week because they can't be fussed to actually fix things and release a major patch in one go seem to have all the issues.

The people at Riot are not perfect, they make mistakes, you make mistakes, I make mistakes, but Riot usually fixes log in errors fairly quickly. I know it sucks to not be able to play LoL when you're short on time but It's impossible to troubleshoot for every scenario every-time.  Stop acting like an entitled first world millennial.
